BasicDescription.Title: This Is CBBC!
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Join the CBBC crew for all your favourite programmes, plus loads more! Tune into CBBC everyday from 7.00am to 7.00pm.

BasicDescription.Title: This Is CBBC
BasicDescription.Synopsis: This is CBBC. Programmes begin at 7.00am.

BasicDescription.Title: Stitch Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A group of undercover kids target members of the public in this practical joke whirlwind of a show. A Saturday worker at a chemist endures a day she'll never forget, in today's Big Stitch Up.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Xchange
BasicDescription.Synopsis: If you're after celebrities, comedy or chat, this is the show for you. Includes Newsround updates.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: Tel: 0845 900 2222 (local rate) - remember to get permission.

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Get the latest from the Fame Academy, where the race for the prize is down to the last few talented hopefuls.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsround
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC joins the Newsround team, who will be keeping you up to date on the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: Looney Tunes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Canned Feud/Stupor Salesman/Mad As Mars Hare: A triple bill of wacky antics starring Sylvester, Daffy Duck, Bugs Bunny and Marvin the Martian.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Megamaths
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Measure. Decorating: The Ace decorator offers advice on measuring walls, and illustrates the importance of using the right tape measure for the job.

BasicDescription.Title: Landmarks
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Investigating Local History. The 1930s In Perivale: A look at the Hoover Building and the growth of the Perivale estate in London in the 1930s.

BasicDescription.Title: Look And Read
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] The Glen Of The Green Man: Josie and Peter are trapped inside a computer game. They meet the Green Man who helps them to the next level of the game.

BasicDescription.Title: Primary History
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Tudor Life. Food - A Housewife's Story: What did people eat 450 years ago? Was it different from what we eat now? How did they prepare their food? Where was it grown? How was it sold?

BasicDescription.Title: Landmarks
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Using The Land. Digging The Landscape: How the differing communities of Orgreave and Hope utilise their land.

BasicDescription.Title: Zig Zag
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Art. Pattern And Texture: Artists and children investigate visual elements. They experiment and have fun with pattern and texture in the natural world.

BasicDescription.Title: Techno
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 11-14] Designing Your Future. Unit 2. Food Technology: A look at the future of food technology.

BasicDescription.Title: Hallo Aus Berlin
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 11-13] Gesundheit (Health): German language series. Esther helps us to warm up our bodies. Marko is injured in a volleyball match and needs to go to hospital for a full check up.

BasicDescription.Title: Belief File
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 11-14] Islam. Prayer: For Muslims, Islam is a complete way of life and affects everything. Muslims must follow the Shari'ah - the straight path, which Allah teaches in the Qur'an.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsround
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC joins the Newsround team, who will be keeping you up to date on the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: History File
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 14-16] Soviet Communism And The Cold War. Stalin Takes Control: Profile of Nadezhda Allilueva, Stalin's wife. Her perception of his achievements was changed by students in the 1930s.

BasicDescription.Title: Techno
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 11-14] Designers. Limited Edition: Two designers use rubber with very different results, and we see how flimsy carbon fibre is transformed into a strong but light racing bike.

BasicDescription.Title: Blue Peter Flies The World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Australia 4 - Matt's Oz Video Diary: A behind the scenes look at life on the road with the Blue Peter team, as they travel from the centre of Australia to the big coastal cites.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Julia Jekyll And Harriet Hyde
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The makers of a television programme, The Fizz, are coming to the Rocket Academy to audition for new talent, and everyone wants to be a star.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Monster Cafe
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Igor's Monster Day: The cafe's customers are mysteriously disappearing, until only Igor is left. It's a monster's worst nightmare - the monster munchers have come to call...
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Simon And The Witch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: While Angelica recovers from her nasty surprise, Lady Fox-Custard organises an entertainment for 'nice' young children and the Witch and Tombola go hunting for snails.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: The Story Of Tracy Beaker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tracy's going to be Child Of The Week in a big advert for foster parents - and she wants her ad to be totally brilliant! Meanwhile, Justine is carrying on like the queen of a make-over show.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Animadness
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A bumper package of cartoon fun, featuring classic episodes of Looney Tunes, plus double helpings of Cramp Twins and Taz-Mania.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Stitch Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Covert cameras capture our undercover kids, up to their distinctively weird and wacky antics. Today's Big Stitch Up follows a fan of Prince William when a look-a-like arrives at her front door.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Looney Tunes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Chow Hound: A big greedy dog makes a frightened alley cat procure him endless dinners, but the peckish pooch is never satisfied. Will the bully get his come-uppance?
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Get the latest from the Fame Academy, where the race for the prize is down to the last few talented hopefuls.

BasicDescription.Title: Xchange
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Xchange gang are back with more celebs, games and chat.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: Tel: 0845 900 2222 (local rate) - remember to get permission.

BasicDescription.Title: Grange Hill
BasicDescription.Synopsis: It's a good night for dating - but who is Mrs Holmes' mystery companion?
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: SMS: 07736 22 22 00 - text CBBC Studio (usual rates apply)

BasicDescription.Title: Newsround Lite
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC joins the Newsround team, who will be keeping you up to date on the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.
